intro: Markea costanensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican markea, is a flowering plant native to the humid lowland forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters and prefers well-drained, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and prominent stamens, and it blooms during the wet season. Markea costanensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
